page.title: 12EARLY HISTORY
page.content: There have been people living in and around Braintree from the Bronze age onwards. Major settlement have tended to develop in two areas. The Chapel Hill and Skitts Hill part of the present town have been inhabited since at least the fifth century B.C. The other area is at the crossroads now at the centre of the present town, developed by the romans an important meeting of roads from colchester to st Albans and Chelmsford to Gosfield. At the time of the Domesday Survey the community at Chapill Hill was larger and with more facilities than that at the cross roads and so had become more important.
